newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary mulls joining Albania peace-keeping force.
newsitem.headline: Hungary mulls joining Albania peace-keeping force.

text.p: Prime Minister Gyula Horn has asked the seven parties in parliament to discuss whether Hungary should join a multinational security force in Albania, Hungarian Television said on Tuesday.
The parties will discuss the issue on Wednesday and the government is likely to make its decision on Thursday, the television said.
A 5,000-strong force is being put together by Italy after receiving approval from the United Nations on Friday.
The multinational force is intended to protect humanitarian relief operations in Albania, where food and medical supplies are lacking after weeks of widespread unrest.
